messages.message:
I was checking whether it’d be easy to unskip `advanced-apps` since it was skipped yesterday (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/58601)

I ran into several issues though
• sometimes the upload area for uploading an ibflowbin is disabled, even though we already wait for billing information to be loaded
• it seems we shouldn’t scroll to the bottom when trying to delete the app since if the app was created properly, the app card will appear at the top
    ◦ if we scroll all the way to the bottom, Cypress won’t be able to find the app card at the top
• sometimes the delete app button isn’t shown when we try to delete the app in the test (see screenshot)
i’ll pause my investigation here, @Weiming Wu can you investigate and figure out how to make this less flaky? for now, i’ll add the `SKIP_CI` tag since we should still run this for UAT purposes

One thing that I noticed recently while testing advanced-apps locally is that sometimes the first billing call returns an error, then the second one returns a success. I guess one thing we can do is wait for a successful call?
also this `AppStore` folder is missing a `dependencies.test.ts` file - how should we define one? @CJ
I'll look into why the scroll is happening though. The util should only scroll when it needs to.
to make the dependencies file, usually what i do is just copy the imports from the route page
For the billing call, could we stub the api request and bypass the check?
ah jessica has a pr to fix that!
